channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16527] IOExceptions from DFS client still can cause CatalogJanitor to delete referenced files
item.description: that was fixed partially in HBASE-13331, but issue still exists , now a little bit deeper in the code.
item.summary: IOExceptions from DFS client still can cause CatalogJanitor to delete referenced files

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
CatalogJanitor:


  Pair<Boolean, Boolean> checkDaughterInFs(final HRegionInfo parent, final HRegionInfo daughter)



SKIP-SKIP

    boolean references = false;

    HTableDescriptor parentDescriptor = getTableDescriptor(parent.getTable());

    for (HColumnDescriptor family: parentDescriptor.getFamilies()) {

      if ((references = regionFs.hasReferences(family.getNameAsString()))) {

        break;

      }

    }

    return new Pair<Boolean, Boolean>(Boolean.TRUE, Boolean.valueOf(references));

HRegionFileSystem:


  /**

   * Returns true if the specified family has reference files

   * @param familyName Column Family Name

   * @return true if family contains reference files

   * @throws IOException

   */

  public boolean hasReferences(final String familyName) throws IOException {

    FileStatus[] files = FSUtils.listStatus(fs, getStoreDir(familyName),

        new FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter(fs));

    return files != null && files.length > 0;

  }

FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter:


    @Override

    protected boolean accept(Path p, @CheckForNull Boolean isDir) {

      if (!StoreFileInfo.isReference(p)) {

        return false;

      }



      try {

        // only files can be references.

        return isFile(fs, isDir, p);

      } catch (IOException ioe) {

        // Maybe the file was moved or the fs was disconnected.

        LOG.warn("Skipping file " + p +" due to IOException", ioe);

        return false;

      }

    }

isFile can throw IOException and we return false (not reference) - which is bad.
patch for master. cc: Ted Yu, Enis Soztutar, Devaraj Das
Vladimir Rodionov any chance of adding a test for this issue?
Have you considered letting FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter surface the IOE instead of swallowing it ?

Have you considered letting FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter surface the IOE instead of swallowing it ?

PathFilter.accept does not throw any exceptions, Ted Yu

Vladimir Rodionov any chance of adding a test for this issue?

That is very hard. Do we have fault injection framework for HDFS?
Let's remove ReferenceFileFilter if we cannot change it so that it throws exceptions. Otherwise, other usages will also miss potential usages and cause subtle issues like this one.

Let's remove ReferenceFileFilter

We have a separate JIRA for that: HBASE-16529 (it will take time to clean up and refactor all PathFilter-related code in HBase). This one is urgent matter and can't wait (RITs , data loss). Patch is ready Enis Soztutar
Hold on, working on a new patch.

Without using FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter, potentially large number of files would be retrieved.

Maybe modify FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter so that it returns true in case of IOE.
Then hasReferences() performs another round of check.
v2. adds exception handling in CatalogJanitor, changes log level of from WARN to ERROR on IOException.

Without using FSUtils.ReferenceFileFilter, potentially large number of files would be retrieved.

10? 50? not 50000. Its OK.

-1 overall
